reviewText: Kate and Allie was the breakout series of the 80's.  Two childhood friends who are divorced share an apartment in NYC with their children.  This examined single moms in the 80's.  Episodes covered everything from jobs to raising kids to dating.  Brilliant from start to finish.There are two minor issues witht this box set.  First, there are no chapters.  If you hit chapter advance it goes to the next episode.  On a half hour show, it is not really deadly.  The second issue is that when you hit chapter advance, the first time it goes to the beginning of the episode.  It really doesn't go back but each episode is on the disc twice.  Don't know why but they are?  Both of these are minor and I can live withThe worst issue I have is that not all the episodes are original broadcast length (24.5 minutes).  I have watched the first two seasons and the following are the episodes that have been edited:Season 1 Episode 4 The Family BusinessSeason 1 Episode 5 Dear DiarySeason 2 Episode 14 If She Goes, I GoSeason 2 Episode 19 Dead CatSeason 2 Episode 20 The Bad SeedSeason 2 Episode 21 Goodbye, Plumber (The best episode of the season!)Season 3 Episode 22 Late BloomerSeason 4 All Episodes except Allie's GraduationSeason 5 Episode 5 onNow I do not blame VEI they can only publish what they are given.  And for the original company, you can't blame them as video was in its infancy and they did not think to save the originals.This is just a warning for the purists, for me something is better than nothing.

reviewText: Kate & Allie was the best show that aired in the 1980s--so much that I actually wanted to write for the series in its final years while attending Ball State University, at a time when I was told it was totally unheard of for twentysomethings to be writing for sitcoms about women nearly twice their age.I want to buy this DVD set, but I need to make sure every episode is included.  From the reviews I have seen, this is not promising.  I gave the high rating because of the series being so great until "The Simpsons" came along.  I would definitely go out with Kate McArdle, the brazen go-getter, in a heartbeat!  It's so odd that Susan St. James and I share the same birthday (August 14); unfortunately, I would end up being her boy-toy, since I was born two decades later!I would love to see a remastered DVD package of "Kate & Allie", complete with audio commentaries and documentaries on the making of the series.  But I won't hold my breath.
summary: If Susan St. James Weren't Already Married, I'd Take Her As My Wife!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This 6-year awesome sitcom introduced a new type of nuclear family to the 1980s: a pair of divorced women living with their children together in a somewhat cramped New York brownstone.The 1st Seasons replacement in the Spring of 1984 starring Susan Saint James as Kate McArdle and Jane Curtain as Allie Lowell was both a critical and commercial success. The shoulder pads, clunky answering machine, and hairdon'ts give away the decade, but the storylines of grown-up best friends supporting and, at times, sparring with each other during personal and professional crises are timeless.Curtain and Saint James share a wonderful chemistry that makes them easy to watch. At the start of this sitcom that ran on CBS from 1984-89, viewers are introduced to Allie's first post-divorce date, played by a dashing young Kelsey Grammar from CHEERS & FRASIER.Almost 2 decades before the gals on SEX & THE CITY began tackling relationships, Kate summed it up best: "Dating's about finding someone so you never have to date again." By the time CBS cancelled KATE & ALLIE in the Spring of 1989, Kate and Allie's relationship had gotten a little hackneyed & stale and it was time for the ladies to move on. But those first few seasons were fast, funny, and full of possibilities since the show was still in its honeymoon phase, but perhaps the whole cast & crew of the show was getting tired & the show was running out of steam.

If you liked the show you'll love having the entire set for your collection. You can watch it whenever you want. All your favorite episodes in one set.  Amazing.

reviewText: The quality on most shows is great. However, I have noticed a few things...- On episode 1, season 2, the tape head that "played" the original video... the tape heads were not aligned, causing a muffled... or as what we called, in the video business... "Muddy" audio. As professionals, I am shocked they did not attempt to correct this. Even better EQing or filtering might have made a difference, if the original was not saved. It maybe can remind me of those "full series" versions of DVD's, you find on pirate websites, when the DVD was never really released, officially.The title opening is cut off, on some episodes. The first note is usually cut off.With those things being said... the video quality is great.Otherwise, love the show!
summary: Love the show, but the quality is OK on some eps
